Articles.Content:
This is a challenge to see who can get the fastest speed with a STOCK JET PLANE.

My plane will soon be uploaded to the spaceport since im the biggest stock aircraft exporter on there. I will then provide a link to it after this challenge is over. I think i created the fastest plane ever under 1000m that goes OVER 440m/s It will serve as the reward to all who participated in this challenge and people who like fast craft.

Now Get your thinking caps on and start building and flying and create the true FASTEST STOCK LOW ALTITUDE JET PLANE!!!

RULES:

Dont steal ideas

Build it from scratch

Have fun and experience PURE SPEED

After you made the craft/tested provide a picture with proof of speed. If you can't provide a picture upload it to the spaceport so it can be tested for its speed or just say it and it might be understandable and alsoprovide f3 log

SPEED MUST BE! achieved UNDER 1000m which is a pretty low altitude

NO CHEATING AND NO MODS

must be completely stock

Leaderboards (scores will take time to be updated) CHALLENGE STATUS: Still going

Numerobis 373 m/s 2nd

WhatShtisthis 247 m/s 6th

Kasuha 214 m/s 7th

Haprdon 373 m/s 2nd

Hodo 309 m/s 5th

Iluinrandir 390 m/s 1st

zorque 337 m/s 3rd

GraviTykillz 318 m/s 3th

Edited December 17, 2013 by josea74
if you're going to require pictures for the challenge then you should do the same for your "score to beat"
May we derive propulsion from something other than the jet engines? It is implied that we can't in the title and description of your challenge but not clearly stated.

Only jets sorry

Edited December 17, 2013 by josea74

From a while back, not exactly a plane built for this challenge.

I probably can bring the speed up a little higher if I removed the structural panels.
What's to stop someone climbing above 1000m and then diving to gain speed before taking a picture once below 1000m?

What's to stop someone climbing above 1000m and then diving to gain speed before taking a picture once below 1000m?

F3 log? It says highest altitude, I think.
I wonder if this one qualifies. If yes, I'll make a faster one.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

373 m/s.

7 turbojets, 1 radial scoop. I think I should have packed more fuel to get another couple m/s.

At these speeds the basic jet is probably actually better.

[edit: actually, seems just barely not, I only get about 360 m/s that way.]

[edit2: if I could reliably fly 100m higher, I could power another turbojet off that single scoop. But KSP's stick feels like the steering on a Dodge -- does nothing, does nothing, oh my god I'm flipping around.]

Edited December 16, 2013 by numerobis

second plane that i have made in the morning:P

Edited December 16, 2013 by petemachineNL

^^ you expect direct link to your hard drive work? (hint: it wont) suggestion make account here: http://imgur.com/ upload your picture and then you can show your awesome pictures.

BBCode link one will show your picture in forum.

Edited December 16, 2013 by TUFOM
373 might be magic number.

It's stock parts but I run FAR+DRE so I am limited a bit.

X-151

And to see how high it will go and how fast it will top out.

337 m/s

Edited December 16, 2013 by zorque
bad link

It's stock parts but I run FAR+DRE so I am limited a bit.

I should play with FAR... But it should get its own leaderboard so that you won't be so limited!

I look forward to multi-km/s infiniglide entries.

i think it will max out somewhere at 400 m/s. The added thrust of the turbojets is compensated by drag which is added.

my record so far lies at 390.6 m/s

Javascript is disabled. View full album

delete this

Edited December 16, 2013 by Iluinrandir
double post

I don't think I did this correctly, but I got pretty darn fast with this... thing. Its hideous, but at the same time, it looks pretty darn cool.

I call her, "The Speed Demon".

She didn't stay underneath 1000m, although, resting happily around 4000-ish, she flew up to 360's-370's.

Very happy about her performance, being that she was only airborn for 4 minutes. Lol

Hoping I didn't screw up too bad. The reason its says 380 something mps on the flight results is because I spun out of control at the end, and started hopelessly plummeting towards Kerbin. So I got some speed then. My final speed around 3000 meters held up through 4000, which was about 360-370.

[Edit #1] How do you make your pictures come up in a gallery format? Im a noob here on the forums.

Edited December 16, 2013 by TomFallion

The 1km limit is a pretty key stipulation: to go fast, you want to fly as high as possible, until you run out of air (at which point you add intakes). If you can fly 380 m/s at 4km, I suspect you're topping out around 280 m/s at 1km.

Awesome! Sadly I forgot to save the plane before I made another! ;(

How do you post pictures in a gallery again?
<imgur>a92kdn</imgur> except with [ and ]

My Entry.

I did use Kerb Paint and it may well be an advantage as everyone knows a red paint job makes your ride faster:sticktongue:

318

Edited December 17, 2013 by GraviTykillz
Three intakes gives enough air for about 9 jets. You'd go faster with a single radial intake.
